results.title: Christie’s to Sell Paul G. Allen’s $1 Billion Art Collection
results.abstract: The sale, which is expected to be the biggest in auction history for a private collection, will offer works from the Microsoft co-founder’s impressive cache that ranges from old masters to contemporary giants.

media.caption: Jasper Johns’s “Small False Start” (1960) is expected to bring at least $50 million. The sale will include more than 150 artworks spanning 500 years.

results.title: Will Your Dog Get Dementia? A Large New Study Offers Clues.
results.abstract: The risk of canine cognitive dysfunction, a.k.a. “doggy dementia,” is far greater in dogs who don’t get enough exercise, researchers found. Their risk factors echo some in humans, whose homes they share.

media.caption: Dante, an 11-year-old Bernese mountain dog who has been diagnosed with canine cognitive dysfunction, at Cass Park in Ithaca, N.Y. on Wednesday.
